Types

openArrayParams = openArray[tuple[k, t: string]]
TK = ref object
  key: NimNode
  case tokenType: TType
  of TVariant:
      variants: seq[tuple[charNode, key: NimNode, tail: TK]]

  of TRange:
      tail: string

  else:
    nil
  case valueKind: NimNodeKind
  of nnkCharLit:
      charNode: char         ## Character-based tokenizier.
                             ## 
                             ## ```
                             ## Plus     > '+'
                             ## Minus    > '-'
                             ## Divide   > '/'
                             ## Multiply > '*'
                             ## ```
    
  of nnkStrLit:
      strv: string           ## All string based tokens based on following case:
                             ## ```{'a'..'z', 'A'..'Z', '_'}```
                             ## 
                             ## Use string tokens to tokenize named
                             ## identifiers such as:
                             ## ```
                             ## Function > "function"
                             ## Import   > "import"
                             ## Class    > "class"
                             ## ```
    
  of nnkCurly:
      variations: seq[NimNode] ## Sets of strings, allowing for tokenizing
                               ## two or more string variations under a single token identifier.
                               ## For example:
                               ## ```Bool_True > {"True", "true", "TRUE", "yes", "Yes", "YES"}```
    
  of nnkCall, nnkCommand:
      tokenizer: tuple[handler: string, charNode: char] ## Optionally, you can pass a custom tokenizer
    
  else:
    nil

Vars

Program = CurrentProgram()
